alert.note: Alert for Addison; Orange; Rutland; Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 14 at 1:07PM EST until January 14 at 1:45PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Burlington has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southeastern Essex County in northern New York... Western Orange County in central Vermont... Southern Addison County in central Vermont... Rutland County in southern Vermont... Northwestern Windsor County in southern Vermont... * Until 145 PM EST. * At 105 PM EST, dangerous snow squalls were located along a line extending from Clarendon Springs to near West Pawlet, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes US 4 and US 7. Locations impacted include... Rutland, Castleton, Sudbury, Salisbury, Rutland City, Middletown Springs, Orwell, Rochester, Benson, Poultney, Chittenden, Fair Haven, West Rutland, Whiting, Ira, Wells, Goshen, West Castleton, Pawlet, and Hancock. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED
